Env custom members should be copied by Env.from(env)

Fixes lostisland/faraday#408.

If middleware or adapters add custom members to env, those members should be
retained.

commit_list.message:
Many changes to daikon recipe

 * using attributes instead of hardcoded values
 * using template for upstart recipe
 * switch between upstart or init.d script based on platform
 * compatible with chef 0.6 (creaky ancient version used by Engine Yard)
 * no login shell for daikon user

*Should* still be compatible with Ubuntu and modern chef (needs testing).

Also remove require rubygems, to place nice with others:

  * http://pkg-ruby-extras.alioth.debian.org/upstream-devs.html

commit_list.message:
That was no REFACTORING.

Oops.

Anyway, we changed course mid-stream in order to:
 * separate error_groups from errors
 * drop the scaffolding, and code it all by hand
 * start fresh, using outside in BDD.

Unfortunately, we took a step that was too big to be a refactoring, and were
left with this mess.  ;-)  It needs to be cleaned up!

commit_list.message:
Much better signal handling

The signals handled are in the README.md.  Most useful new signal is
`QUIT`.

Also:
* many updates to README; added rails specific HOWTO, after_prefork
* fixed bug: workers were shutdown with HUP rather than QUIT
* fixed minor bug: killing *all* workers when there were too many.  The
  appropriate workers would have just been restarted, but that's still
  sloppy.
* code organization and refactoring
commit_list.repo_description: Quickly and easily fork a pool of qless workers

commit_list.message:
Added config file support

Also:
* added README
* added HUP for reload config file
* added *very* simple tests for config file loading
* added default Rakefile, Gemfile for simpler manual testing

Helped by @agnellvj

(recommitted (via commit --amend), because I accidentally reverted some
changes in lib/rescue/pool.rb before working on this.)

commit_list.message:
First pass at resque-pool

heavily cargo culted from unicorn. copy and paste coding as a learning
experience.  ;-)

test via:
  rake -Ipath/to/resque/lib -Ilib \
       -rspec/mock_config.rb \
       -f lib/resque/pool/tasks.rb \
       -t resque:pool

It should be able to start up, start the appropriate children, and
revive children if/when they die.  Children are not yet intelligent
enough to close parent's FDs, etc.

commit_list.message:
Much better signal handling

The signals handled are in the README.md.  Most useful new signal is
`QUIT`.

Also:
* many updates to README; added rails specific HOWTO, after_prefork
* fixed bug: workers were shutdown with HUP rather than QUIT
* fixed minor bug: killing *all* workers when there were too many.  The
  appropriate workers would have just been restarted, but that's still
  sloppy.
* code organization and refactoring
commit_list.repo_description: quickly fork a pool resque workers, saving memory (w/REE) and monitoring their uptime.

commit_list.message:
Added config file support

Also:
* added README
* added HUP for reload config file
* added *very* simple tests for config file loading
* added default Rakefile, Gemfile for simpler manual testing

Helped by @agnellvj

(recommitted (via commit --amend), because I accidentally reverted some
changes in lib/rescue/pool.rb before working on this.)

commit_list.message:
First pass at resque-pool

heavily cargo culted from unicorn. copy and paste coding as a learning
experience.  ;-)

test via:
  rake -Ipath/to/resque/lib -Ilib \
       -rspec/mock_config.rb \
       -f lib/resque/pool/tasks.rb \
       -t resque:pool

It should be able to start up, start the appropriate children, and
revive children if/when they die.  Children are not yet intelligent
enough to close parent's FDs, etc.

commit_list.message:
Env custom members should be copied by Env.from(env)

Fixes lostisland/faraday#408.

If middleware or adapters add custom members to env, those members should be
retained.
